snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Thursday's selection includes Facebook raising its estimate of the number of false accounts, a study showing a greater correlation between a...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Thursday's selection includes Facebook raising its estimate of the number of false accounts, a study showing a greater correlation between a company's stock performance and the presence of women on its board and praise for a new note-taking app.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: A Craigslist Life and a Remix Contest
